remark.p: Non-career appointee. Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary (Turkey).

Deputy Special Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs until March 28, 1966; thereafter Special Assistant to the President; Acting Special Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs during March 1966

President's Special Assistant until May 1967; thereafter Deputy to the Commander, U.S. Military Assistance Command, Vietnam, for Civil Operations and Revolutionary Development Support, and Special Assistant to the Ambassador to Vietnam with the personal rank of Ambassador
Deputy for Civil Operations and Revolutionary Development to the Commander, Military Assistance Command, Vietnam, and Special Assistant to the Ambassador to Vietnam

Deputy for Civil Operations and Revolutionary Development to the Commander, Military Assistance Command, Vietnam, and Special Assistant to the Ambassador to Vietnam, to October 28; thereafter Ambassador-designate to Turkey

member of the National Security Council Staff until September 1965; Deputy Special Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs, September 1965–March 1966; Special Assistant to the President, March 28, 1966–May 1967; Special Assistant to the President for Peaceful Reconstruction in Vietnam, May 1967–November 1968; Ambassador to Turkey from December 3, 1968

Member, National Security Council Staff, until September 1965; Deputy Special Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs, October 19, 1965–March 1, 1966; Special Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs during March 1966; Special Assistant to the President, March 28, 1966–May 1967; after March 1966 Special Assistant to the President for Peaceful Reconstruction in Vietnam; Ambassador to Turkey after December 3, 1968
member, National Security Council Staff, 1961–1965; President's Deputy Special Assistant for National Security Affairs; Special Assistant, September 1965–March 1966
Member of the National Security Council Staff; Ambassador to Turkey from October 1968

Member of the National Security Council Staff until September 1965; Deputy Special Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs, October 1965–March 1966; Special Assistant to the President, March 1966–May 1967; after March 1966 also Special Assistant to the President for Peaceful Reconstruction in Vietnam; Ambassador to Turkey from December 1968

member of the National Security Council Staff until September 1965; Deputy Special Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs October 1965-March 1966; Special Assistant to the President March 1966-May 1967

staff member of the National Security Council Staff until September 1965; Deputy Special Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs, October 1965–March 1966; Special Assistant to the President March 1966–May 1967

consultant, RAND Corporation; Under Secretary of Defense for Policy from October 24, 1979, until January 20, 1981
